content.introduction:
accept4()
 should include 
SOCK_CLOEXEC
 in its type argument to avoid the
file descriptor leakage. Without this flag, an opened sensitive file would
remain open across a fork+exec to a lower-privileged SELinux domain.

Examples:

accept4
(
sockfd
,
 
addr
,
 
addrlen
,
 
SOCK_NONBLOCK
);



// becomes



accept4
(
sockfd
,
 
addr
,
 
addrlen
,
 
SOCK_NONBLOCK
 
|
 
SOCK_CLOEXEC
);
